Package edu.salle.url.api

Class ApiHelper

java.lang.Object
edu.salle.url.api.ApiHelper
public final class ApiHelper extends Object
Helper class with the responsibility of reading and posting Strings to an HTTPS API.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ApiHelper()
    Default constructor, where the client used for HTTPS communication is set up.

  • Method Summary

    Method
    Description

    Method that removes the contents from a URL using the HTTPS protocol.

    Method that reads the contents from a URL using the HTTPS protocol.

  • Constructor Details

    • ApiHelper

      public ApiHelper() throws ApiException
      Default constructor, where the client used for HTTPS communication is set up. A connection to an auxiliary API URL is also performed to verify its status.
      Throws:
      ApiException - If the server can't be reached or the connection is interrupted.

  • Method Details

    • getFromUrl

      public String getFromUrl(String url) throws ApiException
      Method that reads the contents from a URL using the HTTPS protocol. Specifically, a GET request is sent. Any parameters should be included in the URL.
      Parameters:
      url - A String representation of the URL to read from, which will be assumed to use HTTP/HTTPS.
      Returns:
      The contents of the URL represented as text.
      Throws:
      ApiException - If the URL is malformed, the server can't be reached or the connection is interrupted.

    • postToUrl

      public String postToUrl(String url, String body) throws ApiException
      Method that posts contents to a URL using the HTTPS protocol. Specifically, a POST request is sent. The request body is set to the corresponding parameter, and the response body is returned just in case.
      Parameters:
      url - A String representation of the URL to post to, which will be assumed to use HTTP/HTTPS.
      body - The content to post, which will be sent to the server in the request body.
      Returns:
      The contents of the response, in case the server sends anything back after posting the content.
      Throws:
      ApiException - If the URL is malformed, the server can't be reached or the connection is interrupted.

    • deleteFromUrl

      public String deleteFromUrl(String url) throws ApiException
      Method that removes the contents from a URL using the HTTPS protocol. Specifically, a DELETE request is sent. Any parameters should be included in the URL.
      Parameters:
      url - A String representation of the URL to delete from, which will be assumed to use HTTP/HTTPS.
      Returns:
      The contents of the response, in case the server sends anything back after deleting the content.
      Throws:
      ApiException - If the URL is malformed, the server can't be reached or the connection is interrupted.
